name: Maggie Breschi
disabilities: Cerebral Palsy, Cognitive Delay, G-Tube Fed, Seizures (1 or 2 per yr.) Non-verbal, but uses signs, gestures and the Dynavox / iPad (augmentative communication device) to communicate.
hobbies: New Experiences, Hanging out with friends, arts &crafts, visiting the horse farm, feeding & grooming horses, reading, going to the mall, camp, parties, listening to music, the NCR Trail, talking on the phone, bowling,walks in the neighborhood and going to Valley View Farms.
services_needed: 1:1 Support in Home, Community Outings, Feeding & Medication Administration, Physical Activities, assistance with ADLs
misc: Competitive Pay, Field Related Experience for Students, Great Opportunity
hours_needed: 2 -3 students to work 6 - 10 hrs a week
days_needed: various shifts/ flexible hours every day of the week

name: Dreama
disabilities: Dreama has intellectual disabilities, ADHD, and pervasive developmental disorder -- not otherwise unspecified. Most of her skills are on an early elementary school level. She can eat by mouth but gets most of her nutrition through a g-tube. She also self-catheterizes without assistance in addition to using the restroom.
hobbies: Dreama loves animals, swinging, books, music and writing. She is very active and needs close supervision because she can act impulsively. Dreama knows a lot of interesting facts and can tell you a lot about Justin Beiber and Michael Jackson (her two favorite singers), the fire department (she wants to be a fire fighter), and pets. She will remember all of your pets and ask you about them each time she sees you.
services_needed: Someone is needed to get Dreama off the bus, give her afternoon medications, and provide supervision until a parent gets home.

name: Naftali
disabilities: Autism spectrum--medium function in some areas, high function in others. Executive dysfunction, dyspraxia.
hobbies: computers, basketball, current events, action movies
services_needed: Help in home with activities of daily living to improve skill level, confidence, and independence.

name: Pratima Dulloor
disabilities: Our daughter is a fun loving 6 year old on the Autism spectrum, who struggles with Expressive speech and Social skills.
hobbies: Bubbles, songs, physical play, jumping, Zoo animals and reading
services_needed: Volunteers for our play based Autism treatment program. The Son-Rise program is a home-based, parent-directed, 1-on-1 play therapy that focuses on interaction and relational connections. This is an exciting opportunity for open-hearted, energetic, and creative volunteers to help transition Shruti out of autism and into our world. We want you to join us for this amazing adventure!
misc: Are you looking for an opportunity to enrich your life and that of a very special child? Do you want to experience the joys of being part of a creative and enthusiastic team?!?!No experience necessary, training will be provided. Compensation of $10/hr will be provided. Please allow a weekly commitment of 4-5 hours for at least 6 months.

name: Eli
disabilities: Autism, Mitochondrial disorder
hobbies: spinning, playing music, recording, video games, jumping, cooking
services_needed: 1 on 1 attention, administer medication, minimal assistance with feeding/toilet
misc: need of someone to receive eli from school bus and attend him until a parent arrives. schedule varies due to doc appts and school schedule.
hours_needed: after school hrs & full days off when school is closed

name: Eden Walsh
disabilities: I have Rett Syndrome. Because of this, I am unable to speak or use my hands. Sometimes I have little seizures and sometimes I get really frustrated because I can't tell others what I need. I'm able to walk (and run!) but sometimes I'm a little unsteady on my feet. Generally, I'm a happy, giggly little girl, and I want to learn!
hobbies: Hi. I'm Eden and I'm a really sweet, happy little girl. I live on a farm and I love to play outside. I like when my mommy helps me to smell herbs and flowers, and I think trees are hilarious! If there's a dog around, I think they're hilarious, too. Sometimes we go to the pool and I love to float with help from my mom. When we're inside, I like watching cartoons on Sprout and playing with my ipad, or being tickled and snuggled by the many people who love me
services_needed: 1-on-1 support, tube feedings, after school care, occupational, speech, and physical therapeutic integration into interactions, Eden also wears a diaper.

name: Joshua Bumbry
disabilities: Joshua has an intellectual disability which limits his language, comprehension, and communication skills.
hobbies: Joshua loves sports, including basketball, soccer, simple catching and throwing. Riding his scooter, running and being active.
services_needed: I'm looking for after school care for Joshua. From approx. 3:15pm - 6pm.
misc: Joshua is currently in a licensed daycare ctr where he has been for yrs but I am just wanting more for him at this point. I would like someone to be able to get him off the bus and spend time with him: doing activities, working on homework or other lessons, being out in the community etc.

name: Caleb
disabilities: Caleb has a profound language and speech delay; however, he is still able to communicate, just not at his age level
hobbies: Video games, cartoons, parks
services_needed: After school care
misc: Must have own transportation. Would be picking him up from an after school program and transporting him to my home, which is about 2 miles from his school. This position would begin onæAugust 27th.

name: Susu
disabilities: Has Rett Syndrome. Non verbal. No hand use.
hobbies: Music, reading book to her.
services_needed: After school care, feeding changing and supervise.

name: Brennan
disabilities: 5 month old baby diagnosed with Pierre Robin. Was hospitalized for 3.5 months at JHU Children's Center while undergoing a jaw distraction. Has a trach and a gTube, but cognitively is doing remarkably well. We are working on feeding and hope to decanulate/have his trach removed this fall. All in all, he is a happy little baby boy!
hobbies: Stories, Music, Playtime
services_needed: Respite / On-going Support Services. Brennan doesn't qualify for OT/PT services through the Infants and Toddler program at this time, but we really think they've been helping him. We would love to work with OT/PT/Nursing Students who would be interested in meeting/working with Brennan and our family, especially as we start to teach him sign language. I work from home and we have weekday nursing (the hours that I am working), but would love added stimulation/play time for Brennan.

name: Vincent
disabilities: Autism spectrum--medium function in some areas, high function in others. Executive dysfunction, dyspraxia.
hobbies: books, puzzles, riding scooter, swimming
services_needed: working on IEP goals, helping teach ADLs, helping with communication, ensure safety
misc: He is a sweet, loving child who needs routine. He has a brother, age 9, and a sister, age 13

name: Torben
disabilities: High functioning autism. Torben has memory difficulties and pragmatic and receptive processing delays.
hobbies: Old fashion things, electronics, trains, dogs and building things. He a great sense of humor and likes to make people laugh.
services_needed: We are looking for someone who can help out over the summer. He is at camp most of the summer but we have some days where we need help. He will be having a reading specialist over part of the time to work with him.

name: Nathan
disabilities: Down Syndrome and Autism
hobbies: Loves music, reading, roller coasters and swings.

misc: Nathan is a great kid. He is non-verbal but very happy. He loves his family and loves to play on swings.
days_needed: Mondays and Tuesdays during school year.

disabilities: Cerebral Palsy, cortical visual impairment, cognitive delay
hobbies: Music, eating out, going to the movies, going on walks, going to the mall
services_needed: child care, companion, possible transport to regularly scheduled hippotherapy or pt sessions

name: Meghan Baker
disabilities: Meghan has a genetic disorder which causes severe physical and mental development delay; respiratory issues; swallow disfunction; reflux; low tone; and limited speech. Meghan can sit up on her own and is very social and alert.
hobbies: Likes everything electronic - cell phone, iPhones, iPad, computers, laptops, keyboards
services_needed: Respite care. Help with feeding tube; physical support; and oxygen/pulsox when sleeping.

name: Lexi Potter
disabilities: Autism
hobbies: Painting,coloring,bubbles,music

name: Jacob Tracey
disabilities: Cerebral Palsy
hobbies: Swimming, music, outdoors, golf cart rides, eating, swinging, walking in my walker
services_needed: In home one on one support. Positioning, changing, feeding, supervision in the walker, assistance swimming, bathing, must be able to lift.
misc: Jacob is a joy to be with happy most of the time!

name: Breeze
disabilities: Cerebral Palsy. Non verbal. Makes emotional sounds, so you know if she's happy or not. Deaf. She can hear a little with hearing aids and recognizes some sign language. Tube fed, non walker and can't sit unsupported. Wears diapers.
hobbies: Likes to be outside, take a stroll, swing. Enjoys being held. She likes her arms and legs moved and having books read to her. She enjoys petting her cat, Hobo.
services_needed: 1 on 1 support, medication administration, after school care, weekend and summer care. After school 4pm - 630pm, 4 hours on Saturday and 4 hours on Sunday. Summer care, 8am - 630pm.
misc: Breeze is easy to care for. She is totally dependent. She will need to be carried or moved around in her wheelchair or other seating. She's about 40lbs. She has 2 sisters and 1 brother who will be at home a lot of the times.
hours_needed: M-F 4-630pm, Sat & Sun, we can talk about

name: Kaylee
disabilities: Mixed Expressive/Receptive Language Disorder
hobbies: Kaylee likes to swing, go on slide, throw balls, and do interactive songs!

disabilities: Lennox Gastaut Syndrome, severe epilepsy, Autism, moderate mental retardation, Disruptive Behavior Disorder for aggression, property destruction, and elopement
hobbies: Watch tv shows, football and baseball games, shoot hoops, catch, bowling, swimming

name: Jeff
disabilities: adhd,depresion, anxiety, social issues

name: Ryan
disabilities: Ryan has quadriplegic cerebral palsy. As a result, Ryan is physically challenged to sit, stand or walk without aid. He is also developmentally delayed in motor skills. Ryan also has benign epilepsy. Ryan can speak in full sentences and is a very motivated, happy child.
hobbies: Ryan likes to play with trains, read books, watch movies, "cruise" in his powered wheelchair, laugh and learn.
services_needed: We are working parents raising twin 5 year old boys, Ryan and Jason. We are currently seeking a full-time, in-home position for Summer 2013 (May 28-Aug 23, 2013) to care for the twins. Position entails taking the boys to activities in our van, going to local parks, pools, events for activities, playing at home, feeding breakfast and lunch, and one-on-one assistance for Ryan with diaper changing, dispensing oral medications, assistance with fine motor activities, and transport assistance from w/c to floor/bed/carseat.

name: Ruhi Khanna
disabilities: Autism
hobbies: Loves to play with princesses and Barbies.
services_needed: At home play therapy with a gentle approach

name: Matthew
disabilities: Autism, non-verbal, severe food allergy requiring g-tube for amino acid medical food, slightly low tone. Very giggly and happy guy, sweet and somewhat social, emerging communication with iPad, can spell and read pretty well.
hobbies: IPad, reading books, coloring on whiteboard, going for rides in the car, short walks, being pushed on a trike, LEGOs, swimming, playgrounds
services_needed: Looking for weekend or evening care, maybe late afternoon, to give us parents a dinner out every now and then. Matthew has a typical 7 y.o. Brother who is a great help. Matthew is not potty trained yet, and requires being on his gtube backpack every other hour.
misc: He is a happy guy who loves people who come to play with him, especially therapists and teachers who understand how to play with him.

name: Eleanor
disabilities: She has a developmental delay, with a functional age of about 18 months. She has a seizure disorder, which is currently pretty well managed with meds. She has no expressive language, but she can understand speech very well. She has no behavior problems, but she does love to mouth objects, and has had many choking incidents. That's why we can't just leave her with just any babysitter.
hobbies: Generally cheerful, fun toddler who loves music, TV, playing games, "singing," and reading books. She is very social, and she loves her older sister Katherine, who is 7.
services_needed: After school in home care, 2-3 afternoons a week. No special training required, though all language help is appreciated. The most important thing is attention to choking hazards. We are also looking to just have the occasional night out for mom and dad, as we have no family in the area and no babysitter.
misc: Monkton area, off exit 27 from I83
days_needed: 2-4 days per week, again we can be flexible

disabilities: Severe hypotonia, developmentally delayed, seizures, g-tube fed
hobbies: Swimming, listening to stories and music, massages, hanging out with family on back deck, going for walks and watching TV with little brother.

misc: 6 hour shift on Saturdays. Start time flexible.
hours_needed: 6 on Saturday plus weekend evenings as needed
